info.title: Shopware Store API
info.description: This endpoint reference contains an overview of all endpoints comprising the Shopware Store API

links.description: Link members related to the primary data.

included.description: To reduce the number of HTTP requests, servers **MAY** allow responses that include related resources along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents".

meta.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

data.description: The document's "primary data" is a representation of the resource or collection of resources targeted by a request.

oneOf.description: An array of resource objects, an array of resource identifier objects, or an empty array ([]), for requests that target resource collections.

resource.description: "Resource objects" appear in a JSON API document to represent resources.

relationshipLinks.description: A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships"). Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

allOf.description: A `self` member, whose value is a URL for the relationship itself (a "relationship URL"). This URL allows the client to directly manipulate the relationship. For example, it would allow a client to remove an `author` from an `article` without deleting the people resource itself.

link.description: A link **MUST** be represented as either: a string containing the link's URL or a link object.

oneOf.description: A string containing the link's URL.

href.description: A string containing the link's URL.

attributes.description: Members of the attributes object ("attributes") represent information about the resource object in which it's defined.

relationships.description: Members of the relationships object ("relationships") represent references from the resource object in which it's defined to other resource objects.

allOf.description: References to other resource objects in a to-one ("relationship"). Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

relationshipToMany.description: An array of objects each containing \"type\" and \"id\" members for to-many relationships.

jsonapi.description: An object describing the server's implementation

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

description.description: A human-readable description of the problem.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

parameter.description: A string indicating which query parameter caused the error.

criteriaIncludes.description: Specify the fields that should be returned for the given entities. Object key needs to be the entity name, and the list of fields needs to be the value. Fields will not be included, if they are also specified in the excludes. Note that the include fields will only be stripped on the API-Level, consider using the `fields` parameter for performance reasons.

criteriaExcludes.name: excludes
criteriaExcludes.description: Specify the fields that should be excluded from the response for the given entities. Object key needs to be the entity name, and the list of fields needs to be the value. Note that the exclude fields will only be stripped on the API-Level, consider using the `fields` parameter for performance reasons.

CompressedCriteria.name: _criteria
CompressedCriteria.description: Compressed and encoded criteria object. Format: base64url(gzip(json_encode(criteria))). This parameter allows passing complex criteria as a single encoded string instead of multiple query parameters. The criteria object should be JSON-encoded, then gzipped, and finally base64url-encoded. The criteria object structure is defined in the Criteria schema (see #/components/schemas/Criteria).

post.summary: Create or remove a newsletter subscription
post.description:
This route is used to create/remove/confirm a newsletter subscription.

The `option` property controls what should happen:
* `direct`: The subscription is directly active and does not need a confirmation.
* `subscribe`: An email will be send to the provided email address containing a link to the /newsletter/confirm route.
The subscription is only successful, if the /newsletter/confirm route is called with the generated hashes.
* `unsubscribe`: The email address will be removed from the newsletter subscriptions.
* `confirmSubscribe`: Confirms the newsletter subscription for the provided email address.

email.description: Email address that will receive the confirmation and the newsletter.

storefrontUrl.description: Url of the storefront of the shop. This will be used for generating the link to the /newsletter/confirm inside the confirm email.

customFields.description: Custom field data that should be added to the subscription.

200.description: Success

post.summary: Fetch a product listing by category
post.description:
Fetches a product listing for a specific category. It also provides filters, sortings and property aggregations, analogous to the /search endpoint.

**Available Associations:**
- `downloads` - Downloadable files associated with the product (e.g., manuals, digital content)
- `children` - Product variants that inherit from this parent product
- `deliveryTime` - Estimated delivery time for the product
- `tax` - Tax configuration (rate and calculation rules)
- `manufacturer` - Product manufacturer or brand information
- `unit` - Product unit of measure (e.g., piece, liter, kg)
- `cover` - Main product image displayed in listings and detail pages
- `cmsPage` - Custom CMS page layout for the product detail page
- `canonicalProduct` - Canonical product reference for variant consolidation and SEO purposes
- `media` - Product images and media gallery
- `crossSellings` - Cross-selling configurations (related products, accessories, similar items)
- `configuratorSettings` - Variant configurator settings defining available options for product variants
- `productReviews` - Customer reviews and ratings for the product
- `mainCategories` - Primary category assignments per sales channel for SEO and navigation
- `seoUrls` - SEO-friendly URLs for the product across different sales channels
- `options` - Product variant options (e.g., size, color) that define different variants
- `properties` - Product properties and characteristics for filtering
- `categories` - Categories this product is assigned to
- `streams` - Dynamic product streams this product belongs to based on defined filters
- `categoriesRo` - Read-only category tree including all parent categories for optimized queries
- `tags` - Tags for organizing and filtering products
- `seoCategory` - Main category used for SEO URL generation in the current sales channel

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Identifier of a category.

parameters.name: p

get.summary: Fetch a product listing by category
get.description:
Fetches a product listing for a specific category. It also provides filters, sortings and property aggregations, analogous to the /search endpoint.

**Available Associations:**
- `downloads` - Downloadable files associated with the product (e.g., manuals, digital content)
- `children` - Product variants that inherit from this parent product
- `deliveryTime` - Estimated delivery time for the product
- `tax` - Tax configuration (rate and calculation rules)
- `manufacturer` - Product manufacturer or brand information
- `unit` - Product unit of measure (e.g., piece, liter, kg)
- `cover` - Main product image displayed in listings and detail pages
- `cmsPage` - Custom CMS page layout for the product detail page
- `canonicalProduct` - Canonical product reference for variant consolidation and SEO purposes
- `media` - Product images and media gallery
- `crossSellings` - Cross-selling configurations (related products, accessories, similar items)
- `configuratorSettings` - Variant configurator settings defining available options for product variants
- `productReviews` - Customer reviews and ratings for the product
- `mainCategories` - Primary category assignments per sales channel for SEO and navigation
- `seoUrls` - SEO-friendly URLs for the product across different sales channels
- `options` - Product variant options (e.g., size, color) that define different variants
- `properties` - Product properties and characteristics for filtering
- `categories` - Categories this product is assigned to
- `streams` - Dynamic product streams this product belongs to based on defined filters
- `categoriesRo` - Read-only category tree including all parent categories for optimized queries
- `tags` - Tags for organizing and filtering products
- `seoCategory` - Main category used for SEO URL generation in the current sales channel

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Identifier of a category.

parameters.name: sw-include-seo-urls
parameters.description: Determines if the response must contain a SeoUrl entity for a product entity

parameters.description: Specifies the sorting of the products by `availableSortings`. If not set, the default sorting will be set according to the shop settings. The available sorting options are sent within the response under the `availableSortings` key. In order to sort by a field, consider using the `sort` parameter from the listing criteria. Do not use both parameters together, as it might lead to unexpected results.

This endpoint returns categories that can be used as a page navigation. You can either return them as a tree or as a flat list. You can also control the depth of the tree.

    Instead of passing uuids, you can also use one of the following aliases for the activeId and rootId parameters to get the respective navigations of your sales channel.

post.description:
Perform a filtered search for shipping methods.

**Available Associations:**
- `prices` - Shipping method price configurations (based on current cart and context)
- `deliveryTime` - Delivery time information (min/max days, unit)
- `media` - Media/images associated with the shipping method (loaded by default)
- `availabilityRule` - Availability rule determining when this method is available
- `tax` - Tax configuration for the shipping method

**Example with associations:**
```json
{
  "associations": {
    "prices": {},
    "deliveryTime": {}
  }
}
```

Note: The `prices` association is essential for accessing shipping cost configurations.

parameters.description: Instructs Shopware to return the response in the given language.

parameters.name: onlyAvailable
parameters.description: List only available shipping methods. This filters shipping methods methods which can not be used in the actual context because of their availability rule.

- `manufacturer` - Product manufacturer or brand information
- `unit` - Product unit of measure (e.g., piece, liter, kg)
- `cover` - Main product image displayed in listings and detail pages
- `cmsPage` - Custom CMS page layout for the product detail page
- `canonicalProduct` - Canonical product reference for variant consolidation and SEO purposes
- `media` - Product images and media gallery
- `crossSellings` - Cross-selling configurations (related products, accessories, similar items)
- `configuratorSettings` - Variant configurator settings defining available options for product variants
- `productReviews` - Customer reviews and ratings for the product
- `mainCategories` - Primary category assignments per sales channel for SEO and navigation
- `seoUrls` - SEO-friendly URLs for the product across different sales channels
- `options` - Product variant options (e.g., size, color) that define different variants
- `properties` - Product properties and characteristics for filtering
- `categories` - Categories this product is assigned to
- `streams` - Dynamic product streams this product belongs to based on defined filters
- `categoriesRo` - Read-only category tree including all parent categories for optimized queries
- `tags` - Tags for organizing and filtering products
- `seoCategory` - Main category used for SEO URL generation in the current sales channel

post.summary: Initiate a payment for an order
post.description:
This generic endpoint is should be called to initiate a payment flow after an order has been created. The details of the payment flow can differ depending on the payment integration and might require calling additional operations or the setup of webhooks.

The endpoint internally calls the payment handler of the payment method currently set for the order.

finishUrl.description: URL to which the client should be redirected after successful payment

errorUrl.description: URL to which the client should be redirected after erroneous payment

200.description: Redirect to external payment provider
